intro: Papaver sheperdii, commonly known as the Shepherd's papaver, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features smooth, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine environments. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
